avalancheActivity.highlights: Slab avalanches can reach medium size.
avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is moderate above the tree line and low below it. Fresh and older snowdrift accumulations can be triggered as small or medium slab avalanches by a small additional load. Avalanche prone locations are located adjacent to the ridgeline, crest or summit in steep terrain in northern and eastern aspects as well as in gullies and bowls. The number and extent of avalanche prone locations increase with the onset of the storm from midday onwards. Southern slopes must then also be assessed more carefully. In addition to the risk of burial, the risk of being swept away and falling must be taken into account.

snowpackStructure.comment: With the rising, stormy westerly winds, fresh snowdrift accumulations form, which come to rest unfavourably on a soft, soft old snow surface in wind-calm areas, in some cases also on fresh surface hoar. Older wind slabs are sometimes still prone to triggering on old surface hoar. Below a melt-freeze crust close to the surface, faceted crystals can often be found right down to the ground, especially at higher altitudes. There is little snow on the south side.

tendency.highlights: Stormy winds and new fallen snow increase the risk of avalanches.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low and increases to moderate from midday onwards with the onset of stormy westerly winds above the tree line. Snowdrift accumulations can be triggered in the aspects from north-west to north to south in steep, blown-in areas by low additional loads, usually as small snow slabs. The risk of being swept away and falling is usually greater than the danger of being buried.

snowpackStructure.comment: With the rising, stormy westerly winds, small, fresh snowdrift accumulations form, which come to rest unfavourably on a soft, soft old snow surface in wind-calm areas, sometimes also on fresh surface hoar. Older snowdrift accumulations lie on old surface hoar in some places. Below a melt-freeze crust close to the surface, faceted crystals can be found at higher altitudes right down to the ground. There is little snow on the south side.

tendency.highlights: Stormy winds and new fallen snow increase the risk of avalanches.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: From midday onwards, the approaching storm will produce fresh, prone-to-triggering snowdrift accumulations.
